questions.question: What is the principle behind Young’s double-slit experiment?
In Young’s double-slit experiment, what type of light source is typically used?
What does the fringe spacing depend on in the double-slit experiment?

answers.a: The color of the light source
answers.b: The distance between the slits and the screen

questions.question: What would happen if the slits are moved further apart in the double-slit experiment?

answers.d: The brightness of fringes would increase

questions.question: What is the condition for constructive interference in Young’s double-slit experiment?

answers.b: Path difference equals an odd multiple of half the wavelength
answers.c: Path difference equals an integer multiple of the wavelength
answers.d: Path difference equals the wavelength divided by the distance
